Literature Review: Gaussian Process Regression (GPR) has emerged as a powerful tool for modeling stochastic signals in astronomical time-domain data sets. The past two decades have seen a significant expansion in the availability, size, and precision of time-domain data sets in astronomy, driven by advances in observational technology and data analysis techniques. This review aims to provide an overview of the current state of GPR in astronomy, its underlying mathematical theory, and its applications to various astrophysical phenomena.
